thread.title: Rutgers hoops partnering with Cancer Institute
thread.title_full: Rutgers hoops partnering with Cancer Institute

author: app.com
title: Rutgers hoops partnering with Cancer Institute
text:
MORE The Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey sees 8,000 patients a year, including nearly 1,000 kids.
Those kids are getting an assist from Scarlet Knights basketball coach Eddie Jordan.
The third-year skipper chose the institute’s pediatric cancer program as a beneficiary of his program’s inaugural “Eddie Jordan Tip-Off” event Oct. 23.
“We’re thrilled obviously that Eddie has chosen the Cancer Institute as one of his charities,” said Joan Russo, the institute’s chief development officer. “This is a new partnership for us with the athletic department, and we’re excited about it.”
The event takes place from 7-9 p.m. at the RAC. Attendees will get a courtside look at a practice and skills challenges, plus a meet-and-greet with the coaches and players and photo opportunities with Jordan and the Scarlet Knight mascot.
